titlePart.text: SECTION G PHYSICS
INSTRUMENTS
MEASURING
TESTING
WEIGHING

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes immediately following the class title ().

titlePart.text: Weighing apparatus involving the use of a counterweight or other counterbalancing mass
Pendulum-weight apparatus
the pendulum having a fixed pivot axis
with a plurality of pendulums
the pendulum having a moving pivot axis, e.g. a floating pendulum
with a plurality of pendulums
Constructional arrangements for obtaining equal indicative divisions
Temperature-compensating arrangements
Means for correcting for obliquity of mounting
Balances involving the use of a pivoted beam, i.e. beam balances
Beam balances having the pans carried below the beam, and for use with separate counterweights
for precision weighing
Platform-type scales, i.e. having the pans carried above the beam
with associated counterweight or set of counterweights
involving means for automatically lifting counterweights corresponding to the load
with electrical or electromechanical control means
wherein the counterweight is in the form of a chain
wherein the counterweights are in the form of rider-weights
involving a fixed counterweight, with poise-weights selectively added to the load side
wherein the counterweights are slidable along the beam, e.g. steelyards
with automatically-driven counterweight
specially adapted for weighing by substitution
Temperature-compensating arrangements
Weighing apparatus characterised by the use of elastically-deformable members, e.g. spring balances
wherein the weighing element is in the form of a helical spring
using a plurality of springs
wherein the weighing element is in the form of a spiral spring
wherein the weighing element is in the form of a leaf spring
wherein the torsional deformation of a weighing element is measured
wherein the weighing element is in the form of a solid body stressed by pressure or tension during weighing
having piezo-electric or piezo-resistive properties
measuring variations of electrical resistance
Circuits specially adapted therefor
involving comparison with a reference value
involving digital counting
measuring variations of magnetic properties
measuring variations of frequency of oscillations of the body
Temperature-compensating arrangements
Weighing apparatus wherein the balancing is effected by fluid action
with a float or other member variably immersed in liquid
with means for measuring the pressure imposed by the load on a liquid
using electrical indicating means
Weighing apparatus wherein the balancing is effected by magnetic, electromagnetic, or electrostatic action, or by means not provided for in the preceding groups
by electromagnetic action
with means for regulating the current to solenoids
by electrostatic action
Methods of, or apparatus for, the determination of weight not otherwise provided for
Apparatus for weighing a continuous stream of material during flow
Conveyer-belt weighers
having mechanical weight-sensitive devices
having electrical weight-sensitive devices
having fluid weight-sensitive devices
having means for controlling the rate of feed or discharge

titlePart.text: by controlling the height of the material on the belt
by controlling the speed of the belt
using totalising or integrating devices

titlePart.text: being electric or electronic devices
using digital counting
being mechanical devices
Weighing apparatus with automatic feed or discharge for weighing-out batches of material

titlePart.text: Means for automatically loading weigh-pans or other receptacles, e.g. disposable containers, under control of the weighing mechanism
involving dribble-feed means controlled by the weighing mechanism to top up the receptacle to the target weight
wherein the main feed is effected by gravity from a hopper or chute
wherein the main feed is effected by mechanical conveying means, e.g. by belt conveyers, by vibratory conveyers
wherein the main feed is effected by pneumatic conveying means, e.g. by fluidised feed of granular material
Arrangements for compensating for material suspended at cut-off, i.e. for material which is still falling from the feeder when the weigher stops the feeder
Arrangements for determination of, or compensation for, the tare weight of an unloaded container, e.g. of a disposable container
Means for automatically discharging weigh receptacles under control of the weighing mechanism
by valves or flaps in the container bottom
by screw conveyers in the weigh receptacle
by tilting or rotating the receptacle
Weighing mechanism control arrangements for automatic feed or discharge
involving fluid-pressure systems
involving variation of an electrical variable which is used to control loading or discharge of the receptacle
involving comparison with a reference value
involving digital counting
for controlling automatic loading of the receptacle
involving limit switches or position-sensing switches
involving photoelectric devices
involving mechanical linkage motivated by the weighing mechanism
Arrangements for check-weighing of materials dispensed into removable containers
with provision for adding or removing a make-up quantity of material to obtain the desired net weight
with provision for adding or removing a make-up quantity of material to obtain the desired gross weight
Apparatus for, or methods of, weighing material of special form or property
for weighing material of filamentary or sheet form
for weighing fluids, e.g. gases, pastes
having means for controlling the supply or discharge
for weighing livestock
Weighing apparatus or methods adapted for special purposes not provided for in the preceding groups

for weighing during motion

on overhead rails
for weighing aircraft
for incorporation in vehicles

for weighing suspended loads
